Issues.Title: feat(platform-browser): `EventManagerPlugin` to support passive event listeners
Issues.Body:
I propose this `EventManagerPlugin` to support passive event listeners. 
Note: The solution [proposed here](https://angular.io/guide/event-binding#binding-to-passive-events) is global)

I choose to not enable it by default and propose that its activation is opt-in. So `BROWSER_MODULE_PROVIDERS` stays unchanged. 

If this PR moves forward, I'll provide the doc updates. 

Usage : use `(scroll.passive)` as event binding.

Fixes #8866

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?


- [x] Feature

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(platform-browser): `EventManagerPlugin` to support passive event listeners" (#50082)

Issues.Title: Language Service should suggest keyboard modified when using keyboard event bindings
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? language-service ### Description From the docs for [binding to keyboard events](https://angular.io/guide/event-binding#binding-to-keyboard-events), it is possible to use key and code from Keyboard Event to target specific keyboard events like the following:`` This is not suggested by the language service currently. It only suggests events like keyup, keydown, keydown but doesn't suggest using these modifiers on typing `(keydown.)` ### Proposed solution Language Service should suggest modifiers like shift, enter, alt and other key/code from KeyboardEvent so that users can get autocomplete and also prevent typos ### Alternatives considered Use keyboard modifiers without autocomplete with potential for incorrect usage/typos
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Language Service should suggest keyboard modified when using keyboard event bindings" (#50081)

Issues.Title: Provide an alternative to `ComponentFixtureNoNgZone` + `ɵNoopNgZone `
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

While there is no official support for Zoneless apps or Zoneless testing, some public APIs are available and other internal APIs are getting used in the wild:

`ComponentFixtureNoNgZone` is undocumented but part of the public API.
I might be missing something but it could be derived from the injected `NgZone` _(if `NgZone` is null or instead of `NoopNgZone` for example)_. Cf.:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/02a539cb1420d1941a0bbc79e9110cfc347737b5/packages/core/testing/src/test_bed.ts#L601-L603

In order to provide a no-op NgZone in standalone apps or testing, the common workaround is using the following provider:
```ts
{provide: NgZone, useClass:  ɵNoopNgZone}
```
but `ɵNoopNgZone` is internal API.

### Proposed solution

- Derive `noNgZone` state from the injected `NgZone`.
- Expose `NoopNgZone` as public API _(after all it has the same interface as `NgZone` which is already public so in practice, it will probably never change if `NgZone` doesn't change, but! it could disappear if rendered useless in the future)_
or
_provide_ a `provideNoopNgZone()` function which will probably become useless when Zoneless Angular will happen.

### Alternatives considered

Expose a copy of `NoopNgZone` + some provide functions in an external library
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Provide an alternative to `ComponentFixtureNoNgZone` + `ɵNoopNgZone `" (#50079)

Issues.Title: `ng generate --help` in CLI overview results in error
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

If you run the commands in [**Basic workflow**](https://angular.io/cli#basic-workflow) as instructed, you'll get the following result:
```
C:\Users\Name\Desktop\angular
λ ng help
ng <command>

Commands:
  ng add <collection>            Adds support for an external library to your project.
  ng analytics                   Configures the gathering of Angular CLI usage metrics.
  ng build [project]             Compiles an Angular application or library into an output
                                 directory named dist/ at the given output path. [aliases: b]
  ng cache                       Configure persistent disk cache and retrieve cache
                                 statistics.
  ng completion                  Set up Angular CLI autocompletion for your terminal.
  ng config [json-path] [value]  Retrieves or sets Angular configuration values in the
                                 angular.json file for the workspace.
  ng deploy [project]            Invokes the deploy builder for a specified project or for
                                 the default project in the workspace.
  ng doc <keyword>               Opens the official Angular documentation (angular.io) in a
                                 browser, and searches for a given keyword.      [aliases: d]
  ng e2e [project]               Builds and serves an Angular application, then runs
                                 end-to-end tests.                               [aliases: e]
  ng extract-i18n [project]      Extracts i18n messages from source code.
  ng generate                    Generates and/or modifies files based on a schematic.
                                                                                 [aliases: g]
  ng lint [project]              Runs linting tools on Angular application code in a given
                                 project folder.
  ng new [name]                  Creates a new Angular workspace.                [aliases: n]
  ng run <target>                Runs an Architect target with an optional custom builder
                                 configuration defined in your project.
  ng serve [project]             Builds and serves your application, rebuilding on file
                                 changes.                                        [aliases: s]
  ng test [project]              Runs unit tests in a project.                   [aliases: t]
  ng update [packages..]         Updates your workspace and its dependencies. See
                                 https://update.angular.io/.
  ng version                     Outputs Angular CLI version.                    [aliases: v]

Options:
  --help  Shows a help message for this command in the console.                     [boolean]

For more information, see https://angular.io/cli/.

C:\Users\Name\Desktop\angular
λ ng generate --help
Error: This command is not available when running the Angular CLI outside a workspace.
```

So the `ng help` works right away.
But the `ng generate --help` gives an error.
The error is pretty descriptive.
Anyway, I wouldn't want (new) devs to face errors by default, while just going through the basic setup.

**I suggested [this solution (edit of docs)](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/50077)**

Issues.Title: make docs contributions easier (more intuitive)
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

It's great that you have the opportunity to contribute to each page of the docs directly!
I love this & I believe that every great open source project should have something like this.

Even though I've wanted to change a page & have been looking for such a button, I didn't find it.
(So I already started to write an issue to suggest that feature.)
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49591562/235294637-b8974896-f6e6-4b97-8379-83cef6237b01.png)

This *edit* button is super small and only at the top of the page (where you usually don't want to edit anything.
I'd love to have it bigger, more prominent & maybe sticky somewhere at the bottom of the screen or below the navigation on the right.

And let's maybe even add a *call to action*, like they do it at [docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/).
I love that you always see it.
Once you stumble upon a typo or a bug, you'll intuitively report it that way.
And not just having the chance to *edit* a page directly but also having the opportunity to *request a change* (aka. filing an issue to discuss a change) makes it way easier for people to add their ideas and to help improve Angular.🤗
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49591562/235294848-2244e6ff-0925-4bb9-ac00-7a6536126dac.png)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): finalize rxjs-interop options & docs
Issues.Body:
This commit introduces an interface for `toSignal` options to mirror that of `toObservable`, and adjusts docs for both symbols. It also adds the ability for `toSignal` to manually specify `DestroyRef` (similarly to `toObservable` accepting an injector) or for `toSignal` automatic cleanup to be disabled (in which case the subscription persists until the Observable completes). Either option allows `toSignal` to be used outside of a DI context, like `toObservable`.

Issues.Title: fix(platform-server): remove dependency on `@angular/platform-browser-dynamic`
Issues.Body:
Using `@angular/platform-browser-dynamic` is no longer required for JIT scenarios with Ivy. Instead `@angular/compiler` should be imported instead.

This change is part of the effort to reduce the server bundles sizes, which is needed to support cloud workers.

BREAKING CHANGE:
Users that are using SSR with JIT mode will now need to add  `import to @angular/compiler` before bootstrapping the application.

**NOTE:** this does not effect users using the Angular CLI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(platform-server): remove dependency on `@angular/platform-browser-dynamic`" (#50064)

Issues.Title: App served by `ng serve` is not accesible from inside Android Virtual Device
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

I don't know.

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Following this guide:

https://developer.android.com/studio/run/emulator-networking

The web app should be accessible at `http://10.0.2.2:4200` via `ng serve` on the host machine.

But the request times out.

It _**does**_ work with `ng serve --host 0.0.0.0`

Why is `--host 0.0.0.0` necessary? It _**should**_ work with just `ng serve`.

### Minimal Reproduction

- see above for commands run
- no extra packages added
- no code changes or specific code required

### Exception or Error

_No response_

Issues.Body: ### Command serve/build ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description When we setup angular.json style part like this, ``` { "input": "projects/styled-components/scss/line-awesome/line-awesome.scss", "bundleName": "styles-lineawesome", "inject": false }, ``` It should create `styles-lineawesome.css` in esbuild compile. But, with esbuild, it create `styles-lineawesome.[HASHED].css` file. ### Minimal Reproduction ### Exception or Error ```text It should create `styles-lineawesome.css` in esbuild compile. But, with esbuild, it create `styles-lineawesome.[HASHED].css` file. ``` ### Your Environment ```text Angular CLI: 16.0.0-rc.2 Node: 16.19.0 Package Manager: npm 8.19.3 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 16.0.0-rc.3 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, elements ... forms, localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... platform-server, router, service-worker Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1600.0-rc.1 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.0.0-rc.1 @angular-devkit/core 16.0.0-rc.1 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.0.0-rc.2 @angular/bazel 15.2.6 @angular/cdk 16.0.0-rc.1 @angular/cli 16.0.0-rc.2 @angular/material 16.0.0-rc.1 @angular/youtube-player 16.0.0-rc.1 @nguniversal/builders 16.0.0-next.0 @nguniversal/common 16.0.0-next.0 @nguniversal/express-engine 16.0.0-next.0 @schematics/angular 16.0.0-rc.2 ng-packagr 16.0.0-rc.1 rxjs 7.8.0 typescript 5.0.3 ``` ### Anything else relevant? _No response_

Issues.Title: Angular fresh application npm ci gyp command failure
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Create fresh application:
```bash
ng new Application
```
Wait till setup is complete.

Try to test out `npm ci` command
Result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13600914/234979979-43652adc-ceaa-4f0e-b84c-d1885e1e8d2f.png)

I'm not using anything which could intercept with default environment (only `nvm`) and as well not sure why node-gyp-build 've been called. But I've traced deps and found that `node-gyp-build` is dependency of `nice-napi` which is dependency of `piscina` which is dependency of `@angular-devkit/build-angular`.

`node-gyp-build` < `nice-napi` < `piscina` < `@angular-devkit/build-angular`

P.S. Sorry if it is wrong thread but I wasn't able to find correct one

_No response_

I:\Developer\Angular\TestCI\node_modules\nice-napi\binding.cc(2,10): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'unistd.h': No such file or directory [I:\Developer\Angular\TestCI\node_modules\nice-napi\build\nice_napi.vcxproj]

Issues.Title: esbuild failed to process css background images
Issues.Body:
### Command build ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Error while processing images as css background images ### Minimal Reproduction place any image with name "timeline.png" to assets folder ```html
``` ```css .container { width: 300px; height: 300px; border: 1px solid red; background-image: url("~/src/assets/timeline.png") } ``` Works perfectly with default builder, but `browser-esbuild` could not resolve it ### Exception or Error ```text Could not resolve "~/src/assets/timeline.png" [plugin angular-css-resource] apps/esbuild-app/src/app/app.component.css:6:24: 6 │ background-image: url("~/src/assets/timeline.png") ╵ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can mark the path "~/src/assets/timeline.png" as external to exclude it from the bundle, which will remove this error. ``` ### Your Environment ```text _ _ ____ _ ___ / \ _ __ __ _ _ _| | __ _ _ __ / ___| | |_ _| / △ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__| | | | | | | / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | | | |___| |___ | | /_/ \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_| \____|_____|___| |___/ Angular CLI: 15.2.7 Node: 18.13.0 Package Manager: npm 9.2.0 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 15.2.8 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1502.7 @angular-devkit/build-angular 15.2.7 @angular-devkit/core 15.2.7 @angular-devkit/schematics 15.2.7 @angular/cli 15.2.7 @schematics/angular 15.2.7 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 4.9.5 ``` ### Anything else relevant? I use fresh nx project Looks like same problem as #24470
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "esbuild failed to process css background images" (#25089)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): always enable `looseEnums` build optimizer rule
Issues.Body: With this change TypeScript enums are always processing in "loose" mode. Previously, this was only done for `@angular/` packages.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): always enable `looseEnums` build optimizer rule" (#25086)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Easily and continuously experiment with esbuild-based builder" (#25087)

Issues.Title: refactor: replace `node` with `process.execPath`
Issues.Body: This is ensure that the same node executable is used to spawn Jest
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: replace `node` with `process.execPath`" (#25085)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): do not inline sourcemap when using vite dev-server
Issues.Body:
Vite inlines the source map as part of content (https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/ba62be40b4f46c98872fb10990b559fee88f4a29/packages/vite/src/node/server/send.ts#L59-L63) with no option to disable this behaviour. While this is improves performances when Vite is used without prebundling. When using prebundling this is causes an overhead as the response can grow drastically, in some cases over 50mb.

Closes #25012
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): do not inline sourcemap when using vite dev-server" (#25082)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): exclude `@angular/platform-server/init` from unsafe optimizations
Issues.Body: `@angular/platform-server/init` entry-point is side-effectful and thus it's not safe to perform advanced optimizations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): exclude `@angular/platform-server/init` from unsafe optimizations" (#25083)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): provide migration that disables build optimizer on dev server builds
Issues.Body: In https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/25070 we turned on `buildOptimizer` by default for server builds. This causes existing projects development builds to always run build-optimizer. This migration will set `buildOptimizer` to false, when `optimization` is disabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): provide migration that disables build optimizer on dev server builds" (#25084)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-menu-item): iconPositionEnd and matButtonIcon is not available for mat-menu-item
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.x

### Description

Since there was a change in mat-menu-item, that all icons are moved to the start, it is not possible anymore to place icons after the label. This breaks our current design (we have icons in front and after the label)

v15: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/15.2.x/src/material/menu/menu-item.html  
v14: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/14.2.x/src/material/menu/menu-item.html

The solution would be to also support `iconPositionEnd` for mat-menu-items as it was done for mat-button.  
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/15.2.x/src/material/button/button.html#L11

`matButtonIcon` should be supported as well.

_Bonus_: It would probably be even better to _not_ pull the icons automatically to a certain position (like it was before) or to have an additional attribute, so that an icon is not effected by the pulling (e.g. `iconPositionInline` --> `<mat-icon iconPositionInline>...</mat-icon>`). I am not sure, if this is possible with the new mdc and the change happened in the first place, because the new css-class effected the icons. Nevertheless, iconPositionEnd should be possible.

Thank you!
~Manuel

### Reproduction

```
<button mat-menu-item>
   <mat-icon>settings</mat-icon>
   Settings
   <mat-icon>open_in_new</mat-icon>
</button>
```

### Expected Behavior

It should be possible to have buttons at the start and at the end (or inline).

### Actual Behavior

Both/all icons are in the start.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): all
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-menu-item): iconPositionEnd and matButtonIcon is not available for mat-menu-item" (#27006)

Issues.Title: Clean up e2e tests
Issues.Body:
Cleans up our e2e tests. Split up in the following commits:

#### test(multiple): remove unnecessary e2e tests
As discussed, these changes remove the e2e tests that were testing the same functionality as the unit tests. These tests didn't help us to catch any additional issues and were increasing our maintenance cost. I've left in a few tests that make sense to run as e2e (e.g. virtual scrolling and scroll blocking). I've also removed some shared utilities that either weren't used or had one call site left.


#### build: convert e2e app to standalone
Converts the e2e app to standalone APIs to reduce the amout of code we need to maintain.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Clean up e2e tests" (#27001)

Issues.Title: MDC migration: <mat-card> is migrated to appearance=outlined, which is not the MDC standard
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

According to https://m2.material.io/components/cards#anatomy, and https://material-components.github.io/material-components-web-catalog/#/component/card, the standard for cards seems to be "raised". Also, `<mat-card>` without an `appearance` attribute defaults to `raised`.

However, MDC migration for angular V15 always changes `<mat-card>` to `<mat-card appearance='outlined` /> (see https://github.com/angular/components/pull/24566/files#diff-b75b20ff5d2952053d36ef0a202e088d8533fb2e45be536f37973d923cdb0482). 

Why is that? I didn't find any documentation what's the reasoning for this. Shouldn't Angular material match the Material Design Guidelines as close as possible?

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. write an angular component which uses `<mat-card>` in Angular V14
2. migrate to Angular V15 material design according to https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/guides/v15-mdc-migration.md#how-to-migrate


### Expected Behavior

`<mat-card>` remains the same, without any additional appearance (so takes the default `raised` appearance)

### Actual Behavior

`<mat-card>` now becomes `<mat-card appearance='outlined`>`

### Environment

Angular CLI: 15.2.6
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: pnpm 7.29.1
OS: win32 x64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MDC migration: <mat-card> is migrated to appearance=outlined, which is not the MDC standard" (#27004)

Issues.Title: Mat-Select is not functioning properly after angular and material version upgrade from v10 to v15.2.4
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was Angular V10.1.5 and Material V10.2.4 ### Description This report is regarding dropdown field issue of Angular Material V15.2.4 (Mat-Select) Recently, we have upgraded our project's angular version from v10.1.5 to v15.2.4. Application's drop down fields were working fine in angular v10.1.5 and material v10.2.4. But when the version got upgraded with angular v15.2.4 and material v15.2.4., all the drop down fields are facing issue in showing the selected option. **Issue**: - There is no issue in listing the options. - After selecting any one of the option, mat-select has to show up the selected option. - But the field is blank after selecting an option. **Version and Coding strategy**: 1. Reactive Form is used. FormBuilder and FormGroup was used to create formcontrols. 2. After upgrade, All material imports was updated to legacy option. (Example - MatButtonLegacy) 3. In angular v10, Two-way data binding ([(ngModel)]) has been used to bind the id of the selected option, it worked fine. 4. But in v15 we have tried by removing the ngModel, still not fixed. 5. Have tired with [(value)] way of binding, that too didn't give a hand. 6. This is not a multiple select. 7. We have used exact code mentioned below in angular v10 and its not working in angular v15. Find the sample example here - https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples#select-form **Support Needed** 1. Angular support team to provide a solution to fix the issue in Mat-Select drop down. 2. To provide if any code changes or import level changes has to be done. 3. We have tested with angular v15.2.4 and material version as v12.2.13, all seems fine. 4. Is it fine to have a downgraded material version with higher angular version?. 5. **Kindly respond whether it is a good standard to have Angular v15.2.4 and material v12.2.13 as part of production release or provide an fix for the issue in the upgraded versions for both angular and material v15.2.4.** Kindly refer the below attachment which shows actual issue in the dropdown after selecting an option, the field is blank; ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce: 1. Set the angular version as 15.2.4 and material version as 15.2.4 2. Inject a Mat-Select drop down field in template 3. Set a list of options in .ts file for Mat-options (Example - Apple, Orange, Mango etc) 7. Options will be binding correctly in the selectable drop down. 8. Select any one of the values from the drop down list. 9. Issue - After selecting, selected value will not show up in the field. ### Expected Behavior The expected behavior is - After selecting any one of the option, mat-select has to show up the selected option. Expected working one as mentioned in this example - https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples#select-form ### Actual Behavior Actual behavior - After selecting an option, selected value does not show up in the Mat-Select Field. Below one the case where the field is empty after selecting an option. ### Environment - Angular: **v15.2.4** - CDK/Material: **CDK - v15.2.4 and Material - v15.2.4** - Browser(s): **Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge** - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): **Windows**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Select is not functioning properly after angular and material version upgrade from v10 to v15.2.4" (#27003)

Issues.Title: feat(all components): Test id attributes for internal elements
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The v15 mdc merge has just butchered our e2e suite.

There are no known safe mechanisms to target material component internals e.g. a selected pseudo checkbox in a list item,. Until now we have targeted class names, but this has just suffered a monumental amount of breaking changes.

Suggest adding non-changeable `data-test-{target-name}` to targetable internals.

### Use Case

`cy.get('mat-option:not(.mdc-list-item--selected)')`

see: https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices#Selecting-Elements

Issues.Title: feat(mat-select): Improve mat-select harness DX
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Currently, when using `matSelectHarness.getOptions()`, an empty array is returned if the `matSelectHarness.open()` method is not called beforehand. This can be confusing for users, who may not realize they need to call `matSelectHarness.open()` first.

To improve the user experience, I suggest adding an error message similar to what is done in `matAutoCompleteHarness`, so that if `getOptions()` is called before `open()`, an error will be thrown informing the user to call `open()` first.

This change would save users time and frustration by providing immediate feedback on what they need to do to correctly use the `getOptions()` method.

matAutoComplete implementation:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/22e928c4fce56fc3619e7aecd0affbb8972847ae/src/material/autocomplete/testing/autocomplete-harness.ts#L80


I can make a PR for it :)

Thanks.

Issues.Title: bug(table): `renderRows` doesn't trigger change detection in content projection
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Please see the Stackblitz. This is a particular case. However, running `renderRows` on the projected table component doesn't trigger change detection for this child component. Although this behaviour seems correct for the _OnPush_ strategy, I am still looking for ways to make this example work. This isn't particularly a matter only of `renderRows`, but the same behaviour is observed while using Observables or custom Data source.

In other words, how can I set the `dataSource` from the wrapper component and make it run the change detection without actually modifying the projected (child) component?

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qsduhf?file=src%2Ftable.ts

### Expected Behavior

The data source will run the change detection and display table body content.

### Actual Behavior

The table is empty, and no data is projected due to a missing change detection run. Manually running change detection from inside the child component is needed.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.8
- CDK/Material: 15.2.8
- Browser(s): Version 112.0.5615.137 (Official Build) (arm64) 
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(table): `renderRows` doesn't trigger change detection in content projection" (#26985)
